alert.note: Alert for Wichita (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 13 at 2:22AM CST until December 13 at 3:15AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CST FOR WESTERN COMANCHE...SOUTH CENTRAL KIOWA...TILLMAN...NORTHWESTERN WICHITA AND SOUTHEASTERN WILBARGER COUNTIES... At 222 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Indiahoma to 4 miles north of Hollister to 4 miles north of Electra, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Frederick, Cache, Electra, Snyder, Grandfield, Chattanooga, Mountain Park, Indiahoma, Manitou, Hollister, Loveland, Harrold, southwestern Fort Sill, Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge and Haynesville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
